Posts.Content: Nov 15, 2011 01:50AM LesleyZ wrote: Cookie Monster....I didn't get the names of the hospitals.  He said out of state and I immediately lost interest.  I want to say they were both teaching hospitals.  I'm curious to find out what my stage is after surgery...tumor size, and confirmation of the lack of cancer in my lymph nodes.  More waiting....it has to be the worst part!
Posts.Title: My BMX Has Been Rescheduled for December 5th Blessings2011 rachelvk

Posts.Content: Nov 15, 2011 07:48PM LesleyZ wrote: blessings - sorry you aren't more improved than you are....probably a good move leaving the 12/5 date as is.  I know I keep looking at the calendar and wanting time to slow down because that date is only less than 3 weeks away!  You have been ready to go though twice before so I understand wanting to get it over with.  Me - I am struggling between wanting to get this cancer out before it spreads and not wanting to have the surgery at all.  DH and I watched a video last night that my docs office sent me for "pre-op" preparedness....you know, all the risks, etc.  Also talked about getting the "stage" of the cancer after surgery, the lymph biopsy etc.  Honestly, I think it made me more nervous.  I don't like the idea of general anesthesia, but I guess I don't have a choice with this surgery.  I had a lower back spinal fusion done last January....and I was REALLY intent on that being the LAST surgery I ever have....right...now I'm in for what, 3 more at least?  I guess the good side is that the next two after 12/5 will be "simple" compared to these others.  The other good side is that this 12/5 surgery should be MUCH easier to recover from than my last surgical experience.  I just want 12/5 to take it's sweet time getting here!  I bought a groupon last week for 4 hours of house cleaning for $39!  I've already got it set up to use it on the day before christmas eve as my DH family celebrates at our home on xmas eve.  At least I will have a clean house and still be able to rest and recover! What are your xmas plans?
Posts.Title: My BMX Has Been Rescheduled for December 5th Blessings2011 rachelvk

Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2011 03:13AM LesleyZ wrote: Hi blessings...I'm on a BMX date with immediate reconstruction for 12/5/11 too I just got a call today with my genetic testing, which was negative   My other testing including lymph node u/s, chest xray and blood work was all looking good too...so I am hopeful to hear the "all clear" in the lymph node biopsy on the 5th, just like you! Are you doing implants or a flap?  I'm doing implants....I don't qualify for the TRAM and too afraid of the DIEP (besides, the doc said he would only recommend 2 hospitals in the US for Diep and neither are in Michigan).  I'm kind of worried about doing the implants, because of the risks and lifetime follow up involved, but I don't think I could do nothing at all. Did you see an oncologist yet?  My doctor said that I will likely have to have chemo due to the size of the tumor, but we will know for sure after surgery.  I'm just wondering if it is normal to not see one before surgery / just after the diagnosis?  Sorry you have been delayed, but glad to have someone with the same surgery on the same day as me
Posts.Title: My BMX Has Been Rescheduled for December 5th Blessings2011 rachelvk

Posts.Content: Nov 13, 2011 04:24AM LesleyZ wrote: Nice to meet you as well! I thought you might be interested in this I was searching the web trying to find some pictures of someone who had the bilateral mastectomy done and what they looked like right after they got out of surgery with the TE's.  I found this girl's blog who has taken pictures of the entire process.  She didn't have cancer, but had the gene so the doctors recommended that she have the mastectomy.  She has not posted pictures yet of her final surgery, where they do the nipples and final filling in of the areas around the implants, but she has the first two surgeries and process where the fills are done documented in the photos.  It was really helpful in letting me know kind of what to expect.  Below are the links to the two blog sections if you are interested in seeing them....The girl is very young...and much thinner than me, so mine will certainly not look the same but it is still helpful I think.  You have to scroll down on the blog a little to get to the pics.  She also has documented her entire process in detail. This is the link for the 1st surgery and the "fills" that are done afterward http://sameerandapril.blogspot.com/2011_01_01_archive.html This is the link for the second (to put the implants in) http://sameerandapril.blogspot.com/2011/05/day-1-to-3-weeks-post-op-exchange.html
Posts.Title: My BMX Has Been Rescheduled for December 5th Blessings2011 rachelvk

Posts.Content: Nov 27, 2011 04:44AM LesleyZ wrote: Hey Blessings....I haven't been on in a bit, trying to keep myself busy I guess it must be working!  Trying to get all my christmas shopping done before our big day...just about a week away now!  Yikes!  So, I'm almost done with the shopping, just need to finish DH tomorrow and then DONE!  I wish I could avoid the sick bugs, but to do that I would have to leave my house more!  DH and my 15 year old son are both sick with a bad cold.  DH is almost over it, had it for about 2 weeks now, my son has been sick for about a week.  I am praying that I don't get this bug as I don't want this surgery to be delayed...you know that all too well! I was thinking about needing the cleaning person AFTER the party!  I may just need to pay her to come back...but hoping that my family will be thoughtful enough to clean up a bit before they run out the door....we shall see.  My sister in law and niece have both told me they are coming over early that day to help get everything ready, so hopefully that is going to help.  I almost feel like I may be better off with just me telling DH and my son what I need, rather than have to worry about telling people where things are and all that jazz.  But, it was nice of them to offer and I'm sure it will be helpful.  I'm hoping by xmas eve I will be feeling good.  I still won't be able to lift much and stuff, but hoping to at least feel decent by then.  I've talked to a few people that have had the same surgery and they were able to return to work in 4 weeks (desk job), so I'm thinking we should be ok by christmas Good idea on the newsletter "prediction"!  I'm sure it is going to come out that way for both of us! Here we are....the final countdown.....
Posts.Title: My BMX Has Been Rescheduled for December 5th Blessings2011 rachelvk

Posts.Content: Oct 26, 2011 09:42PM LesleyZ wrote: mdg - I live in Troy, MI - north of detroit Diana - You are a strong woman!  You are my idol!  I know someone who was diagnosed last summer 2010 with a very aggressive BC and given 30% chance of survival...I'm proud to say she is finished with treatment, cancer free, and getting stronger everyday!  It can be beat! bx's were yesterday.  Docs office scared me a bit by calling today and moving my result appt up from Friday to tomorrow....but i'm getting the results a day earlier so I am glad.   I will keep you posted!  Please continue to fight the good fight Diana!

Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2011 12:57PM LesleyZ wrote: Update - They moved my appointment up to 11:45 this morning.  Unfortunately, I got bad news.  Invasive Carcinoma with Ductal and Lobular Differentiation...whatever that means?  They set up an appt or me today at 5pm with the breast surgeon....what do I ask?
Posts.Title: Concerned, Confused, and Angry LesleyZ LesleyZ

Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2011 10:09PM LesleyZ wrote: Thanks to all of you.  I am not a lay down and die type of person, so I know this road will be tough but I will be on top of that mountain looking back at what I have come through with my head held high. Here is what I found out tonight at the BS office - does not think the nodes are going to be involved, but will need to do all the standard tests first, lymph ultrasound, chest xray, MRI on both breasts (i have some tenderness in the right side so we want to ensure nothing is going on there), blood work, and i am going to get the genetic testing since I am only 41 and have also had my uterus removed at 27 due to pre-cancerous/hyperplasia.  We do not know the ER/PR/HER2 results yet.  Because of the mass being on the nipple and surrounding area, the doc is recommending a mastecomy....which was a blow at first, but I'm quickly adjusting to the idea.  Depending on the genetic testing results and the MRI results, I may have bilateral mastectomy....they are going to schedule me for that much time and if I decide not to, they will change it (so they can get the time scheduled and coordinated with the plastic surgeon).  I will likely have to have chemotherapy after surgery.  This is primarily due to the size of the mass, and the chance that a cell could have broken off at some point - as well as due to my age.   The doctor was pretty upset about the fact that this was not caught last year.  He said clearly it was cancer at that time on the u/s and mammo.  He said that the outcome would be the same - except the chemo would have likely not been  needed.  He said if we find out that it has gone to the lymph nodes, that this would be absolutely because it was not acted upon last year by the doctors who were responsible for advising me of the test results and ordering additional follow ups.  I got copies of all the reports today.  I am not a "sue happy" person....but I am so TICKED about this situation I cannot help but think I will see an attorney about this in the future.  But right now I am just going to focus on getting better. I need to know how long you all think I would have to be off work for the mastectomy?  I have a sit down job/office work, so I'm hoping it won't be long.  I was off work for 3 months in the beginning of this year for my lumbar fusion surgery, so I don't currently have any family medical leave left....also my annual bonus is now going to be cut even more because of more time off. Thanks again for all of your support! You all are AWESOME! Lesley
Posts.Title: Concerned, Confused, and Angry LesleyZ LesleyZ

Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2011 09:39PM LesleyZ wrote: Thanks for all your continued comments and support.  I am very happy that it seems I won't be off work for very long at all.  I was worried it would be several months!  Sounds more like a few weeks   I will deal with the chemo part when I get there.  A coworker of mine who has gone through this gave me some good advice...take it one step at a time....and only focus on the current step.  I think that is a good idea.  So right now, I am going to focus on getting that call on monday with my appointment dates, testing information, and surgery date. You are all wonderful!  This site has been so helpful.  The bs was so surprised about all the things I already knew about when I was there Thursday!  I told him that I am a person who likes to be prepared and to understand everything I am hearing.  You all have made that possible!
Posts.Title: Concerned, Confused, and Angry LesleyZ LesleyZ

Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2011 02:46PM LesleyZ wrote: Cool Breeze - you are SO right!  Shame on me!  I usually get my test results...I think I was so focused on my back problem last fall (which I had surgery for in January) that this was not something I was focused on and it slipped to the wayside unfortunately.  I certainly learned my lesson...and I'm sure it won't be the last one!

Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2011 12:49PM - edited Oct 21, 2011 12:52PM by LesleyZ Yes, that lovely "dense breasts" thing...I've been told the same.  My mother has very "cystic" breasts and due to our lack of technology at the time, she has had probably 20 lumpectomies since she was 20 yrs old.  I don't have a lot of bc in the family, but a great aunt that had mastectomy due to bc and an aunt that has multiple cancer types throughout her body including bc ...and is terminal.  she wasn't diagnosed until around 60 though. I don't know what I would do if they said I had to decide about a mastectomy.  You are brave and I am glad you are cancer free now.  What happens when they do a mastectomy and reconstruction?
Posts.Title: Concerned, Confused, and Angry LesleyZ LesleyZ

Posts.Content: LesleyZ wrote: Newbie here.  Let me start by saying I found 2 lumps last July 2010.  I went to the Gyno for an annual exam in late August and told her about them....she felt them as well and advised me to get a mammogram and ultrasound asap...which I did, Sept 28 2010.  I called her office for over a week afterward to try and get results and ultimately heard from my regular general doctor with the results before I heard from her office!  I was told that the results were indicative of fibroadeomas and that I was to follow up with a mammogram in 6 months. Fast forward to February 2011...my regular doc gave me an order for a follow up mammogram...I got a letter immediately afterward saying the results were normal/benign and to follow up again with my regular annual mammogram in September 2011.  My regular doc again gave me an order for my regular mammogram, which I had done on 10/4/11.  Now comes the interesting part...I get a call from the radiology department at the hospital a few days later, asking me if I ever followed up after 9/28/10 to get the ultrasound done???  I advised them that I had the US done and called them back and advised it was done the same day as the mammogram-9/28/10.  They proceeded to tell me that the 9/28/10 report advised me to get another US done in 3 months...which I was never advised to do....by anyone.  After a few phone calls to confirm this was not a mistake, I scheduled the follow up US...which was done this past Monday 10/17/11.  On Saturday 10/15, I got a letter telling me my mammogram was normal/benign.  During the US, the tech was at first very informative, explaining to me that US shows things that Mammograms can't determine...she showed me the screen and the first mass that she showed me, I didn't even know I had...and how it was perfectly round - smooth edges, and clearly benign.  Then she went to the others that I found July 2010 - and stopped telling me anything...this was not round, not smooth, etc.  I waited for them to come and tell me I could leave....but instead the nurse came and told me to follow her...where she told me that I need to have 2 core biopsies done as soon as possible....which are scheduled for Tuesday 10/25/11.  I am trying not to worry...but the fact that this was supposed to be done 9 months ago is kind of freaking me out.  I am mad that this was never communicated to me and scared that the results could be bad....but still trying to think that there is no way I could have BC.  I am also very mad about the fact that this would happen to me...I have had so many medical issues and surgeries in my life.  I just had a lumbar fusion in January 2011 and I just want to be healthy and not have to go to the doctor all the time!  I'm 41 years old and feel this is just unfair. LesleyZ Dx 10/27/2011, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2011 09:24PM LesleyZ wrote: jstunme - looks like we are on this road together....whether we like it or not! I've been just in a daze...Thursday was shocking/devastating/then calming at the surgeon's office, yesterday morning I woke up and thought I was fine and all the sudden I just started balling again....couldn't seem to kick it yesterday.  Ended up sleeping several hours during the evening and then couldn't get my mind to stop and let me go to sleep at night.  Today started rough, had to meet some family members and was worried about keeping my composure....but all went well and other than a couple little meltdowns I have done well.  Mostly just scared and still hoping to wake up to a different reality.  I got some good advice though...take it one step at a time....my current step is to wait for monday to get my call with all of my appointment dates/times for all the additional work up....and to get my surgery date.  That is all I'm going to try and think about. Posts.Content: LesleyZ wrote: Biopsy 10/25/11, diagnosis appt 10/27/11 - Invasive ductal carcinoma with ductal and lobular differentiation...mass is somewhat large due to "lack of proper treatment last year" (my BS' words at initial consult on 10/25/11).  BS advised due to the location (on nipple/around it) will need to be mastectomy, so I am opting for bilateral because I don't think I could deal with the interim visual picture before reconstruction is finished....and because I don't want to worry forever about BC in the other one (i am 41).  BS says I will also need post op chemo.  Today was my PS appointment which went well.  I thought I wanted FLAP, but because I am doing bilateral and because of having 3 prior surgeries (up & down c-sections and partial hyst) to the center of my abs/belly I am not a good candidate...so he convinced me that the best option for me is immediate reconstruction with expanders and implants later.  My additional testing (MRI/lymph ultrasound/bloodwork, etc) is all scheduled for this Friday.  Thing is...surgery is scheduled for 12/5...seems so far away.  I know they are both Top Docs in my area and so I know they are booked up and this is a major surgery, but I just worry that the biopsies could have "poked the hornet's nest" and want this done as soon as possible.  Is it normal for the date to be a month out after they have rushed to do everything else so fast?  I don't want to have cancer...but I do...so in my mind I just want to get this over with....one step at a time.  4 weeks of waiting seems like just more chinese water torture to me. LesleyZ Dx 10/27/2011, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Got my genetic test results...no gene....I'm 41 so it causes me to wonder then, why?  I'm happy that I don't have the gene, just confused.  I'm telling myself that this is god's or my body's way of slapping the crap out of me and telling me to wake up and eat healthy and take care of my body as it is the only one I have.  So I've started focusing on eating right and trying to think healthy.  I'm now waiting again...waiting for a stage, size of tumor, lymph node "all clear"....this waiting is the worst.  Really do not want to have another surgery (I've had my fair share)....and here I am, going to have at least 3 in the next year.......

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2011 08:02PM LesleyZ wrote: Hello all you brave and strong ladies! Just wanted to post that I had my BMX with TE's on 12/5.  Came home early 12/6 and things are going pretty good.  Yes, the drains are a PAIN!  I have 2 on each side (total 4) and am hoping to get at least one or two taken out tomorrow at my PS follow up.  However, I do have some swelling on the right side (prophy side) that isn't going down and one of those drains is not producing very well.  I don't have a fever and it isn't hot so we will just see what the PS says tomorrow.  I have slept in my bed the last couple nights as I cannot stand the recliner anymore...it bothers my back.  I just use lots of pillows!  Here is what I have needed since coming home: fanny pack has come in so useful for those drains....i use a long shoestring around my neck for them in the shower (able to take one on 12/6 AND WASH MY HAIR!)  You will need your medicines in ziploc bags or something because you will not be able to push down on the lids to open them.  I needed to send my hubby to get gas-x the day after I got home.  The only other things were button up shirts and a friend made me two small soft pillows that have come in really handy.  Hoping to get the pathology results on the lymph nodes and staging tomorrow. If anyone has any questions, feel free to ask/pm me.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Dec 2011 hawaiik Blessings2011

Posts.Content: Dec 15, 2011 05:46PM LesleyZ wrote: Well, so much for getting my last two drains out this week....still putting out too much fluid, so I will get them out Monday when I get my first expansion.  Jildalove - I wish they would have done the implants already!  Lucky you! My swelling is coming down now (which must be why the fluid levels are still so high), but my underarm area is just killing me/very irritated! Nice to read everyones updates on how you are all doing!  I go in to the BS tomorrow for my post op visit and treatment plan for the Cancer....wouldn't it be nice if I went in and he said...Oh, you are all done from this aspect!....one can wish, right?!
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Dec 2011 hawaiik Blessings2011
